benchmark_details.name: Waste-Bench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Evaluating VLLMs in Cluttered Environments
benchmark_details.overview: Waste-Bench is designed to evaluate the robustness and reasoning capabilities of Vision-Language Large Models (VLLMs) in waste classification, addressing the complexities of real-world applications involving cluttered scenes and deformed objects.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of Waste-Bench is to rigorously test and evaluate the capabilities of VLLMs in handling waste classification tasks under challenging conditions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The scope of evaluation is limited to a specific set of cluttered environments, which may not fully represent the variety of real-world scenarios.

data.annotation: Human-in-the-loop filtering and review process ensuring quality and relevance.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the number of correct predictions over total predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy reflects the model's ability to answer questions correctly based on the visual content.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated under consistent conditions, ensuring uniformity across tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personal identification details are included.
